titleStmt.title: Whereas the Parliament stands prorogued untill the tenth day of April next, and whereas for sundry causes and considerations, we have thought it fit and convenient and necessary further to prorogue the said Parliament untill the second day of May next ... by the Lord Deputy, Ossory.
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lord Deputy.
Ossory, Thomas Butler, Earl of, 1634-1680.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by John Crook ... and are to be sold by Samuel Dancer ...,

notesStmt.note: Title from first 6 lines of text.
Statement of responsibility transposed from head of title.
"Given at the Council chamber in Dublin the thirtieth day of March, 1665."
Reproduction of original in the Society of Antiquaries Library, London.
